Add status command for campaign overview
design:
Add 'mewt status' command to provide comprehensive campaign state in a single command. Currently users must run multiple print commands and mentally aggregate results.

Output should be verbose per-file breakdown showing:
- Each target file path
- Per-target mutant counts: total, tested, untested, caught, uncaught, timeout, skipped, build_fail
- Per-target catch rate by severity (high/medium/low)

End with codebase-wide aggregations:
- Total targets, mutants, outcomes
- Overall catch rate by severity
- Progress: % complete (tested/total)

Goal: Quickly identify which files are well-tested vs which have non-negligible test gaps. Per-file stats are more actionable than aggregate stats.

Support --format flag (table, json) for both human and programmatic consumption.

Target files:
- src/core/cli.rs (add Status variant to Commands enum)
- src/core/cmds/status.rs (new, implement status command)
- src/core/cmds/mod.rs (export status module)
- src/core/store.rs (may need new query methods for aggregations)
acceptance_criteria:
1. 'mewt status' command exists
2. Shows per-target breakdown: file path, mutant counts by status, catch rates by severity
3. Shows codebase-wide aggregations at end
4. Supports --format table (default) and --format json
5. Single command provides complete campaign state
6. Output clearly identifies files with test gaps vs well-tested files

title: Support batch operations from files and stdin
design:
Add --ids-file option to 'mewt test' command to support reading mutant IDs from files or stdin. Currently limited to comma-separated IDs on CLI, which is cumbersome for batch operations.

Enable pipelines like:
  mewt print results --status Timeout --format ids | mewt test --ids-file -
  mewt print results --line 45 --format ids > line45.txt && mewt test --ids-file line45.txt

Design:
- Add --ids-file <path> option to TestArgs (use '-' for stdin)
- If --ids-file provided, read from file/stdin; otherwise use --ids CLI arg
- Split input by whitespace/newlines, parse as i64 IDs
- Validate IDs and pass to existing test logic
- Composable with Unix tools (grep, awk, etc.)

Scope limitation:
- Only applies to 'mewt test' command (not 'run' or other commands)
- No need to support both --ids and --ids-file simultaneously (--ids-file takes precedence)
- Basic error handling: warn on invalid IDs, skip them, continue with valid ones

Target files:
- src/core/cli.rs (add ids_file: Option<String> to TestArgs)
- src/core/cmds/test.rs (parse file/stdin, extract IDs, call existing test logic)
acceptance_criteria:
1. 'mewt test --ids-file <path>' reads IDs from file
2. 'mewt test --ids-file -' reads IDs from stdin
3. Supports newline and whitespace-separated IDs
4. Works with pipelines: 'mewt print results --format ids | mewt test --ids-file -'
5. Handles invalid IDs gracefully (warn and skip)
6. --ids-file takes precedence over --ids if both provided
7. Existing --ids functionality unchanged

Add machine-readable output formats to all print commands
description: Agents need structured data (JSON/JSONL) to process results programmatically. Add --format flag to all print commands (results, mutants, mutations, targets) supporting json and jsonl formats.
design:
Agents need structured data (JSON) and standards-compliant formats (SARIF) to process results programmatically. Add --format flag to all print commands and the results command supporting json and sarif formats.

IMPORTANT: Promote 'results' to top-level command (from 'print results') as it's high-traffic and doesn't need nesting like other less common print subcommands.

All formats accessible via --format flag on existing commands (no separate export command).

JSON: For programmatic access, jq piping, and external tool integration. Structure as arrays or objects as appropriate for each command.

SARIF (Static Analysis Results Interchange Format): Standard for static analysis results, integrating with GitHub/GitLab/VS Code/security tools. For mewt:
- Only 'results' command supports SARIF (results-focused format)
- Export only uncaught mutants as SARIF warnings (test gaps are hints, not errors)
- Include location (file:line), rule (mutation type slug), severity level
- Add message with mutation details (originalâ†’mutated text)
- Completely ignore caught mutants and invalid results
- Map to: ruleId=mutation_slug, level=warning, message=mutation details, locations=file:line

Modify src/core/cmds/print/*.rs to add format parameter. Create serializable output structs using serde_json. Add SARIF serialization to outcomes.rs. High impact, low effort.

Target files:
- src/core/cli.rs (add Results variant to Commands enum; add format options to PrintArgs and ResultsArgs)
- src/core/cmds/results.rs (move from print/outcomes.rs, add JSON/SARIF serialization)
- src/core/cmds/print/mutants.rs (add JSON serialization)
- src/core/cmds/print/mutations.rs (add JSON serialization)
- src/core/cmds/print/targets.rs (add JSON serialization)
- src/core/types/*.rs (add Serialize derives)
- src/core/cmds/mod.rs (export results module at top level)
acceptance_criteria:
1. Promote 'print results' to top-level 'results' command (mewt results, not mewt print results)
2. Add --format flag to 'results' command and all remaining print subcommands
3. Support json and sarif formats (table and ids already exist)
4. JSON output includes all data from human format (table/ids)
5. JSON schema is consistent and documented
6. SARIF output includes only uncaught mutants as warnings with location, rule, severity, message
7. SARIF ignores caught/invalid mutants (warnings only, no errors)
8. Default to human-readable table format for backward compatibility
9. jq-compatible JSON structure for piping and field extraction
10. No separate export command needed - all via --format flag

title: Add introspection commands for discovery and context

design: Add commands to src/core/cli.rs. capabilities queries LanguageRegistry, status queries DB metadata, describe queries mutant details. May need campaign metadata table. Medium effort, high impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. mewt capabilities command lists languages and mutations
2. mewt status shows database state and campaign progress
3. mewt describe <mutant-id> shows detailed mutant info
4. All commands support --format json

title: Add dry-run mode to show execution plan

Show resolved test command, timeout, mutant count, skip optimization status. Add 'mewt resolve-test-cmd <path>' for just the test command.

acceptance_criteria:
1. mewt run --dry-run shows execution plan without running
2. Output includes test command, timeout, mutant count, skip status
3. mewt resolve-test-cmd <path> shows resolved command
4. Support --format json

title: Add meaningful exit codes and final campaign summary
description: Agents need explicit completion status, not heuristic detection. Add structured status to campaign operations: status (complete/partial/interrupted), progress counts, resumption info, next_mutant_id, time estimates. Include in both human and JSON output.
design: Modify campaign runner in src/core/runner.rs. Add progress tracking. Store metadata in DB. Output summary on completion and interrupt. Medium effort, high impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. Exit code 0 when all mutants caught
2. Exit code 1 when uncaught mutants found (test gaps exist)  
3. Exit code 2 when interrupted or error
4. Final summary shows: tested, caught, uncaught, skipped
5. Summary in both human and --format json (if we add json)
notes: UPDATED: Focus on exit codes and final summary, not progress during execution (already covered by progress bar). Agents need: meaningful exit codes (0=success, 1=gaps found, 2=error) and final summary counts.

title: Add rich filtering to all print commands
description: Limited filtering forces agents to post-process output. Add comprehensive filters to all print commands. 'mewt print results' should support --status, --language, --mutation-type, --line, --file. Add --format ids to output just IDs (one per line) for piping to other commands.
design: Add filter params to PrintArgs. Implement in DB queries. Add special --format ids handling. Document filter combinations. Medium effort, medium impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. print results supports status, language, mutation-type, line, file filters
2. print mutants supports line, file, mutation-type, tested/untested filters
3. Add --format ids for piping workflows
4. All filters composable (AND logic)
5. Filtering in DB queries, not post-processing
notes: ELEVATED: This is the RIGHT way for agents to handle large datasets (potentially tens of thousands of mutants/results). Agents should filter to relevant subset through the tool, not dump everything. Essential for agent usability with large campaigns.
